title: Norwich 1-3 Manchester United: Anthony Martial, Marcus Rashford and Scott McTominay kick-start Red Devils’ season
text:
Anthony Martial scored an exquisite goal (Picture: Getty)

Manchester United won away in the Premier League for the first time since February with a 3-1 victory against Norwich at Carrow Road.

Ole Gunnar Solskjaer made plenty of changes from the side that beat Partizan Belgrade on Thursday but the Red Devils started brightly and should have been ahead but for a wonder save from Tim Krul.

But United didn’t have to wait long for the opener as Scott McTominay scored from the resulting corner when he found the bottom corner with a clean strike.

It was United’s 2000th goal in the Premier League era but Marcus Rashford squandered an opportunity to get their next one when he missed a var-awarded penalty.

McTominay opened the scoring (Picture: Getty)

The England international made amends moments later though when he latched onto Daniel James’ pass and slipped a shot under Tim Krul.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Anthony Martial should have put the game to bed shortly before half-time when Todd Cantwell was adjudged to have handled in the area but once again Krul was equal to the spot kick.

The Canaries should have halved the defecit after halftime but Teemu Pukki missed a sitter when he failed to convert Max Aarons cross.

And they were punished for their missed chances when Martial scored a sublime goal after smart interchange with Rashford before lifting the ball over Krul.

United looked to be heading for a clean sheet but McTominay gave the ball away and Cuba international Onel Hernandez punished the mistake by firing past David De Gea.

Solskjaer will be relieved that his side held out and the win means they climb eight places in the table from 15th to 7th.

description: Manchester United won away in the Premier League for the first time since February with a 3-1 victory against Norwich at Carrow Road. Ole Gunnar Solskjaer made plenty of changes...
